sections.title: Welcome to FRC Java Programming
sections.content: This comprehensive curriculum is designed for students with a solid Java background who want to learn FRC (FIRST Robotics Competition) robotics programming. The curriculum is structured in three progressive tiers, each building upon the previous level.

sections.title: Curriculum Structure
sections.subtitle: Our curriculum follows a progressive learning path designed to take you from basic robot control to advanced autonomous systems.
items: Beginner Tier: Focus on WPILib setup, Git/GitHub basics, basic robot structure, drivetrain control, gamepad control, sensors, simple autonomous, and basic mechanisms
Intermediate Tier: Command-based programming, PID control, motion profiling, PathPlanner, and AdvantageKit swerve tuning
Advanced Tier: AdvantageScope, advanced logging, simulation, and advanced topics for competition robotics

sections.title: Prerequisites
sections.content: Before starting this curriculum, you should have:

items: Solid understanding of Java programming fundamentals
Basic knowledge of object-oriented programming concepts
Basic knowledge of arrays and data structures
Understanding of Git version control basics

sections.title: Learning Resources
sections.content: This curriculum is based on the following authoritative sources:

items: WPILib Documentation - Official FRC programming framework documentation
FIRST Technology Information - Official FIRST resources and documentation
PathPlanner - Autonomous path planning tool
AdvantageScope - Data analysis and visualization tool

sections.title: Development Environment
sections.subtitle: You'll learn to work with the professional FRC development environment:
items: WPILib: Official FRC programming framework with comprehensive libraries and tools
Git/GitHub: Version control and collaboration tools essential for team development
AdvantageKit: Advanced framework for complex robot control and data logging
PathPlanner: Visual path planning tool for autonomous routines

sections.title: Getting Started
sections.content: Start with the Beginner Tier if you're new to FRC programming. Each lesson includes hands-on exercises and example code. Make sure to complete the exercises and experiment with the provided code examples.
